result.execSummary:
The defendant DARRELL J. DESCHLER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Winnebago County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Bond applied.  Balance due.  Fine and costs to be paid within 60 days of sentencing, unless payment arrangements are approved.  Penalty for non-payment shall be entry of civil judgment.   Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees.  Send payments to:  Clerk of Courts, Room 110, 415 Jackson Street, P O Box 2808, Oshkosh WI  54903-2808.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Immediately following court, please call 920-236-4906 to schedule an appointment.  Report to:  Room 15 on the lower level of the Courthouse, 415 Jackson Street Oshkosh WI.  Collections are done Monday - Friday 8:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.  You have 72 hours to make arrangements to complete collection.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

Defendant shall report for fingerprinting and photos pursuant to Wis Stats 970.02(7) to room 15, lower level of the Courthouse.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. DARRELL J. DESCHLER

records.addlTxt: Defendant DARRELL J. DESCHLER in custody appeared by video means (zoom) from the Winnebago County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Stephanie Ann Stauber appeared for State of Wisconsin. No victim. DE continues to obtain attorney. DE has not contacted PD. Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

08:40 AM Defendant DARRELL J. DESCHLER in court VIA ZOOM, in custody WINNEBAGO COUNTY JAIL.  Amanda Lynn Folger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Advised of and waives rights.  Copy of complaint received by defendant.  Contact Public Defender's Office.  Plea entered by the Court.  The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

DC(DV), 2 COUNTS BAIL JUMP
CONDITIONS:  Comply with the Alcohol 24/7 Program. Defendant shall contact (920)232-1919 IMMEDIATELY after their court hearing to schedule an appointment to be set up on the program.  If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  The defendant shall bring the Alcohol Monitoring Device to every hearing.  Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol consumption or possession.  Do not be on the premises of any bars or taverns.

03:14 PM Defendant DARRELL J. DESCHLER in court with attorney Ryan S Van Ells.  Defendant DARRELL J. DESCHLER in custody.  Tucker T. Tellefson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DARRELL J. DESCHLER appeared by video means with Attorney.  Given/has complaint. Advised of charges & potential penalties.  The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 3:19.
faxed to Sheriff's Office for handout to DE with their copy of the criminal complaint.
